questions.question_text: A wireless engineer has been asked to plan a deployment covering the aisles of a warehouse with optimal coverage while bleeding RF across aisles. Which antenna type provides the necessary coverage?

discussion.content: I'm not sure about that. It says optimal coverage in the isle, with bleed over. That seems that we want max signal in the isle, which the patch would provide as it's directional. Since it's not nearly as directional as the yagi or dish, it would provide more bleed over than they would.
Surely this must be OmniDirectional if there is a requirement for bleed between isles
Yeah for the CCNA DC exam
Seems from another Cisco Cert, I fully agree.
This question must be for a different exam yes?

questions.question_text: Which two Cisco WLC management-access methods are available as the default setting? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
According to this document, telnet and http are disabled by default and ssh and https are enabled.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-0/configuration-guide/b_cg80/b_cg80_chapter_011.html
Sorry, B and E, HTTP and HTTPS

I would say A and E, with default settings for management.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-4/config-guide/b_cg84/initial_setup.html
Via Wireless Clients—Enabled
HTTP/HTTPS Access—Enabled
WebAuth Secure Web—Enabled

Mayve the word "Pro" is important.
Ekahau Site Survey Pro
Page 471 Official Cert Guide
Both ESS and Fluk air magnet pro are correct. This questions should have two valid answers.

questions.question_text: Which tool can be used for active and passive site surveys?

discussion.content:
This example shows the software install file command being used to expand and copy the packages from a Cisco IOS XE bundle located on a TFTP server in order to upgrade to a new image:
SwitchControllerDevice# 
software install file tftp://172.19.211.47/cat3k_caa-universalk9.SSA.03.12.02.EZP.150-12.02.EZP.150-12.02.EZP.bin
Preparing install operation ...
